Author: Harry et al
Rationale: Recapture did not form expected number of growth zones. Calcein did not mark pregnant females.

Rationale: Recapture did not form expected number of growth zones

Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature

Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature

Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature. Re-analysis of Kerr et al (2006)

Author: Andrews et al

Comment: Max vertebral age from Hale and Baremore (2013) and max actual age based on tagging

Author: Andrews et al
Comment: Max vertebral age from Hale and Baremore (2013) and max actual age based on tagging

Author: Natanson et al
Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature

Author: Chin et al
Rationale: Recapture did not form expected number of growth zones
Comment: Calcein marks visible in 8 of 11 sharks. Apparent age underestimation in sharks 8-11 years

Author: Parsons
Comment: Two individuals did not have annual banding. Four out of five wild caught and recaptured sharks failed to form OTC mark on vertebrae

Author: Hale and Lowe
Comment: Also including data from Hale et al (2006)

Author: Ardizzone et al
Rationale: Phase-shift noted in one specimen, attributed to methodological error
Comment: Possible in one older specimen but attributed to dietary phase lag not age underestimation

Author: Campana et al
Comment: Includes maximum age from Nammack et al (1985)

Author: Campana et al
Rationale: Phase-shift noted in at least one specimen, attributed to methodological error
Comment: Maximum age from McFarlane and Beamish (1987)

Author: Kinney et al
Comment: Main study conducted by Well et al (2013). Maximum age of 22 based on Lyons et al (2015)

Author: Natanson et al
Comment: Maximum age based on Adrizzone et al (2006), conducted concurrently. Additional information on size modes and growth presented but largely dismissed

Author: Gruber and Stout
Comment: Maximum age from Brown and Gruber (1988)

Author: McPhie and Campana
Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature

Author: Kalish and Johnston
Rationale: Phase-shifted C14 signature
Comment: Max age based on recapture at liberty 42 years

Author: Pierce and Bennett
Rationale: Recapture did not form expected number of growth zones

Author: Frazier et al
Rationale: Recapture did not form expected number of growth zones. Long-term recapture suggested greater longevity than growth zones counts.

Author: McFarlane and Beamish
Comment: See also Beamish and McFarlane (1985)

Author: Tucker
Comment: OTC mark visible in only 35% of fish, maximum age from Campana et al (2006)

Author: Goldman et al
Comment: Oldest individual from study by Passerotti et al (2014)

Author: Tanaka
Comment: Individuals marked but died after short time in captivity

Author: Natanson
Rationale: Annual growth zones may cease when females reproductively active

Author: Davenport and Stevens
Rationale: Long-term recapture suggested greater longevity than growth zone counts
Comment: Also includes later data on recaptures up to 18 years from Stevens et al (2000) and Last and Stevens (2009)

Author: Wintner and Cliff
Comment: Oldest individual from study by Christiansen et al (2016)

Author: Watson and Smale
Comment: Period of captivity too brief

Author: Gallagher and Nolan
Comment: Single recapture of an undescribed species

Author: Walker et al
Rationale: Frequency of growth zones in sharks >1400mm (mean age ~11) was significantly < 1
Comment: Age range taken from Moulton et al (1992). Synthesis of data including from Officer et al 1997

Author: Walker et al
Comment: Frequency of growth zones not significantly different to 1. Pattern holds for all sizes. Age range taken from Moulton et al (1992). Synthesis of data including from Officer et al (1997)

Author: Ryland and Ajayi
Comment: No details provided

Author: Tovar-Avila et al
Comment: Maximum age from Tovar-Avila et al (2009)

Author: Izzo et al
Comment: Reported on successful uptake of calcein

Author: Driggers et al
Comment: Maximum age from Frazier et al (2015)

Author: O'Shea et al
Comment: Insufficient time at liberty to be useful for validation

Author: Timmons and Bray
Comment: Uniquely used terramycin for chemical marking. Lengths or ages of marked individuals not given
